text: @karenfinerman K, regarding your suggestion that short sellers file 13Ds (over 5%) on short positions. With 1 or 2 well known exceptions , a hedge fund's individual short position is never anywhere near 5% of float. Most/many large hedgehoggers have abandoned individual

shorting because it wont move the needle. In terms of $SQ, only about 4.5% of total float is short. I do believe, on the other hand, that some visible and well known money managers take large positions in advance of negative research and cover the positions relatively soon

thereafter - which is not illegal but is unethical. So I agree with you, there should be some type of disclosure, but not confined to the 5% threshold. @dougkass @riskreversal @guyadami @threadreaderapp unroll
@steveliesman was A+ in his question to the feckless Fed Chairman and his "gang that couldnt shoot straight." @tomkeene @lisaabramowicz1 @CNBC @ScottWapnerCNBC @carlquintanilla
